Believers Include a Physician who Claims it Works Wonders|last=Ingram|first=Jeanne|date=Feb 24, 1984|work=Rome News-Tribune|accessdate=30 December 2013}}{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=861&dat=20041106&id=LQJZAAAAIBAJ&sjid=C0YNAAAAIBAJ&pg=6710,1153970|title=Transcendental Meditation Advocates Point to its Success at Private Iowa Academy|last=Condon|first=Patrick|date=Nov 6, 2004|work=The Victoria Advocate|page=3D|accessdate=30 December 2013}} According to educator James Grant, a former [[Maharishi University of Management]] Associate Professor of Education and the former Dean of the College of Arts and Sciences, Maharishi brought out a "full revival of the Vedic tradition of knowledge from India" and demonstrated its relevance in many areas including education, business, medicine and government.{{Cite book|last=Grant|first=James|title=The university in transformation: global perspectives on the futures of the university|editor1-first=Sohail |editor1-last=Inayatullah |editor2-first=Jennifer |editor2-last=Gidley|page=209|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|year=2000|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=I_jaYF-iyp0C|chapter=Consciousness-based Education: A Future of Higher Education in the New Millennium}} ===Publications=== The Maharishi wrote more than twenty books on the Transcendental Meditation technique and Maharishi Vedic Science.{{Cite web|url=http://maharishi-programmes.globalgoodnews.com/publications/books.html|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5sMTLRrk9?url=http://maharishi-programmes.globalgoodnews.com/publications/books.html|archivedate=30 August 2010|publisher=globalgoodnews.com|title=Maharishi's Books: Enlightenment for Everyone and Every Nation|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} ====''The Beacon Light of the Himalayas''==== In 1955, the organisers of the Great Spiritual Development Conference of Kerala published ''The Beacon Light of the Himalayas'', a transcribed 170-page "souvenir" of the conference. Authors Chryssides, Humes and Forsthoefel, Miller, and Russel cite this as the Maharishi's first published book on Transcendental Meditation, although Transcendental Meditation is not mentioned in the text of the book.{{Cite book|url=http://www.paulmason.info/gurudev/sources/pdf/Beacon%20Light%20of%20the%20HImalayas.pdf |author=Maharishi Mahesh Yogi|title=Beacon Light of the Himalayas|year=1955|format=PDF}}{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jxIxPBpGMwgC|last= Chryssides|first=George D.|title=Exploring New Religions|publisher=Continuum International Publishing Group|year=1999|isbn=978-0-8264-5959-6 |page=293}}{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ugSb7mArJlYC&pg=PA77&dq=beacon+light+of+the+himalayas#v=onepage&q=&f=false |last1=Forsthoefel|first1=Thomas A. |last2=Humes|first2=Cynthia Ann|title=Gurus in America|publisher=SUNY Press|year=2005|isbn=978-0-7914-6573-8|page=77}}{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=og_u0Re1uwUC&pg=PA193&dq=beacon+light+of+the+himalayas#v=onepage&q=&f=false |last=Miller|first=Timothy|title=America's Alternative Religions|publisher=SUNY Press|year=1995|isbn=978-0-7914-2397-4|page=193}}{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=TZ89AAAAIAAJ|last=Russell|first=Peter|title=The T.M. Technique: An Introduction|publisher=Routledge|year=1977|isbn=978-0-7100-8539-9|page=75}} The book is dedicated to Maharshi Bala Brahmachari Mahesh Yogi Rajaram by his devotees of Kerala and contains photographs, letters and lectures by numerous authors which appear in various languages such as English, Hindi and [[Sanskrit]]. ====''Science of Being and Art of Living''==== In 1963, the Maharishi audiotaped the text of the book ''Science of Being and Art of Living'', which was later transcribed and published in fifteen languages.Maharishi Mahesh Yogi (1986) p. 459, "There was not much time for writing a book, so Maharishi said, 'I'll speak it out on tape, and then you'll get it printed'."{{Cite book|title=Encyclopedia of Religion|editor1-first= Lindsay |editor1-last=Jones|location=Detroit|publisher=Macmillan Reference |page=3|isbn=0-02-865981-3}} K.T. Weidmann describes the book as the Maharishi's fundamental philosophical treatise, one in which its author provides an illustration of the ancient Vedic traditions of India in terms that can be easily interpreted and understood by the scientific thinking of the western world. In the ''Science of Being'', the Maharishi illustrates the concepts of relative existence as the experience of everyday reality through one's senses, and absolute reality as the origin of being, and the source of all creative intelligence.{{cite book|last=Bono|first=Joseph|title=Caveat Emptor, Let the Buyer Beware: A Consumers Guide To Mental Health Services [Paperback]|date=September 11, 2006|publisher=AuthorHouse|isbn=978-1425945633|page=118}} The Maharishi describes this absolute reality, or Being, as unchanging, omnipresent, and eternal. He also identifies it with bliss consciousness. The two aspects of reality, the relative and the absolute, are like an ocean with many waves.{{cite book|last=Olson|first=Carl|title=The Many Colors of Hinduism: A Thematic-Historical Introduction|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RVWKClYq4TUC&dq=the+science+of+being+and+the+art+of+living&source=gbs_navlinks_s|date=August 15, 2007|publisher=Rutgers University Press|isbn=9780813540689}} The waves represent the relative, and the ocean beneath is the foundation of everything, or Being. Establishing oneself in the field of Being, or unchanging reality, ensures stability. In his ''Science of Being'' the Maharishi introduced an additional concept: that of fulfillment viewed as something to be obtained not through exertion or self effort, but through the progressive settling of the mind during the practice of TM.{{cite book|last=Russell|first=Peter|title=From Science to God: A Physicist's Journey Into the Mystery of Consciousness|year=2011|publisher=New World Library|isbn= 9781577319917|page=73}} This was the first full systematic description of the principles underlying the Maharishi's teachings.{{cite book|last1=Wujastyk|first1=Dagmar|last2=Smith|first2=Frederick M.|title=Modern and Global Ayurveda: Pluralism and Paradigms |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=M3XBu-vpXgoC&dq=The+science+of+Being+and+art+of+living&source=gbs_navlinks_s|date=July 10, 2008|publisher=SUNY Press|isbn= 9780791478165|page=288}} ====''Bhagavad-Gita: A New Translation and Commentary'': 1967==== In his 1967 publication, ''Bhagavad-Gita: A New Translation and Commentary'', the Maharishi describes the Bhagavad Gita as "the Scripture of Yoga". He says that "its purpose is to explain in theory and practice all that is needed to raise the consciousness of man to the highest possible level."{{Cite book|author=Maharishi Mahesh Yogi|year=1969|title=Maharishi Mahesh Yogi on the Bhagavad-Gita : A New Translation and Commentary, Chapters 1–6|location=New York|publisher=Penguin Books|pages=20–21|isbn=978-0-14-019247-6}} According to Peter Russell, the Bhagavad-Gita deals with the concept of loss of knowledge and subsequent revival, and this is brought out by the Maharishi himself in the introduction.{{cite book|last=Russel|first=Peter|title=The TM Technique|edition=4th|year=2002|publisher=Elf Rock Productions|isbn=1-928586-07-4|page=134}} In the Preface, the Maharishi writes: "The purpose of this commentary is to restore the fundamental truths of the Bhagavad-Gita and thus restore the significance of its teaching. If this teaching is followed, effectiveness in life will be achieved, men will be fulfilled on all levels and the historical need of the age will be fulfilled also."Yogi, Maharishi Mahesh (1969) page 17 A second concept, that of freedom, presented as the antithesis of fear, is also prevalent in the book, according to Jack Forem.Forem, p. 274 (2012) Forem states that in his interpretation of the Gita, the Maharishi expressed several times that as man gains greater awareness through the practice of Transcendental Meditation, he gradually establishes a level of contentment which remain increasingly grounded within him and in which the mind does not waver and is not affected by either attachment or fear.Forem, p. 275 (2012) ==Characterizations== The Maharishi was reported to be a vegetarian, an entrepreneur, a monk and "a spiritual man who sought a world stage from which to espouse the joys of inner happiness".Koppel, Lily (8 February 2008) [https://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/06/world/asia/06maharishi-1.html Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, Spiritual Leader, Dies] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160428031334/http://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/06/world/asia/06maharishi-1.html |date=28 April 2016 }} ''The New York Times'' He was described as an abstemious man with tremendous energy who took a weekly day of silence while sleeping only two hours per night. He did not present himself as a guru or claim his teachings as his own. Instead he taught "in the name of his guru Brahmananda Saraswati" and paid tribute to him by placing a picture of Saraswati behind him when he spoke. He was on a mission to bring the ancient techniques of TM to the world. Scientist and futurist [[Buckminster Fuller]] spent two days with the Maharishi at a symposium at the University of Massachusetts in 1971 and said, "You could not meet with Maharishi without recognizing instantly his integrity."{{Cite book|last=Mason|first=Paul|year=1994|title=The Maharishi – The Biography of the Man Who Gave Transcendental Meditation to the World|page=221|publisher=Element Books Ltd.|location= Shaftsbury, Dorset|isbn=1-85230-571-1|quote=What makes Maharishi beloved and understood is that he has manifest love. You could not meet with Maharishi without recognizing instantly his integrity. You look in his eyes and there it is.}} Authors [[Douglas E. Cowan]] and [[David G. Bromley]] write that the Maharishi did not claim any "special divine revelation nor supernatural personal qualities".{{cite book|last=Cowan|first1=Douglas E. |last2=Bromley|first2=David G. |year=2008|publisher=Blackwell Publishing|title=Cults and New Religions: A Brief History|page=68|isbn=978-1-4051-6128-2}} Still others said he helped to "inspire the anti-materialism of the late 60s" and received good publicity because he "opposed drugs".{{Cite book | publisher = Columbia University Press | isbn = 978-0-231-12155-2 | last = Allitt | first = Patrick | title = Religion in America Since 1945: A History | date = 20 September 2005|page=141 }} According to author Chryssides, "The Maharishi tended to emphasize the positive aspects of humanity, focusing on the good that exists in everyone."{{Cite book | last1 = Chryssides | first1 = George D. | title = Exploring new religions | year = 1999 | publisher = Cassell | location = London | isbn = 978-0-8264-5959-6 | pages = 293–296| url=https://books.google.com/books?id=jxIxPBpGMwgC&pg=PA293&dq=#v=onepage&q=&f=false }} According to ''[[The Times]]'' the Maharishi attracted scepticism because of his involvement with wealthy celebrities, his business acumen, and his love of luxury, including touring in a [[Rolls-Royce (car)|Rolls-Royce]]. A reporter for ''[[The Economist]]'' calls this a "misconception" saying: "He did not use his money for sinister ends. He neither drank, nor smoked, nor took drugs. ... He did not accumulate scores of Rolls-Royces, like [[Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh]]; his biggest self-indulgence was a helicopter. "{{cite news|url=http://www.economist.com/node/10683705?story_id=10683705| work= ''The Economist'', U.S. Edition|title= Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, guru and tycoon, died on February 5th, aged 91 (probably)|date= 16 February 2008}}{{Cite book|last=Mason|first=Paul|year=1994|title=The Maharishi – The Biography of the Man Who Gave Transcendental Meditation to the World|page=221|publisher=Element Books Ltd.|location= Shaftsbury, Dorset|isbn=1-85230-571-1|quote=Other popular misconceptions are that he amassed a huge fleet of Rolls Royce cars and private aeroplanes, but, people easily confuse him with other Indian teachers, such as Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh and Guru Maharaj Ji.}} When some observers questioned how his organisation's money was being used, the Maharishi said, "It goes to support the centres, it does not go on me. I have nothing."[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/obituaries/article3320882.ece Maharishi Mahesh Yogi Guru of transcendental meditation who used his association with the Beatles to create a hugely profitable global movement] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100524223404/http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/obituaries/article3320882.ece |date=24 May 2010 }}, ''[[The Times]]'', 7 February 2008 He was often referred to as the "Giggling Guru" because of his habit of laughing during television interviews.{{cite news|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20126074,00.html|title=Feeling Guru-Vy|last=Tresniowski|first=Alex|work=People|publisher=Time Inc.|year=1998|accessdate=31 March 2013}}{{cite news|title=All you need is love and peace – but not in destructive Britain, so maharishi pulls out: Followers split as 95-year-old guru ends meditation teaching in 'scorpion nation'|first=Mark|last=Honigsbaum|work=The Guardian|date=15 August 2005|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2005/aug/15/health.healthandwellbeing|archivedate=11 December 2010|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5usr9DD4z?url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/uk/2005/aug/15/health.healthandwellbeing|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} Diminutive at a little over five feet tall, the Maharishi often wore a traditional cotton or silk, white [[dhoti]] while carrying or wearing flowers. He often sat cross-legged on a deerskin and had a "grayish-white beard, mustache and long, dark, stringy hair".{{cite news|title=Invitation to Instant bliss|work=Life|date=11 November 1967|page=26}} [[Barry Miles]] described the Maharishi as having "liquid eyes, twinkling but inscrutable with the wisdom from the East".{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=kkXNECitum0C|last=Miles|first=Barry|title=Paul McCartney: Many Years from Now|publisher=Macmillan|year=1998|isbn=978-0-8050-5249-7|page=401}} Miles said the Maharishi in his seventies looked much younger than his age.{{cite news|title=The return of Mister Bliss|work=Life|first1=David|last1=Friend|first2=Dilip|last2=Mehta|date=November 1990|page=82}} He had a high pitched voice and in the words of Merv Griffin, "a long flowing beard and a distinctive, high pitched laugh that I loved to provoke". Biographer Paul Mason's web site says that Swami Swaroopananda, one of three claimants to the title Shankaracharya of [[Jyotir Math]], is "an outspoken critic" of the Maharishi. According to Swaroopananda, the Maharishi "was responsible for the [[Jyotir Math#1954 to present|controversy over Shankaracharyas]]" because he gave Shankaracharya Swami Shantanand encouragement and assistance in fighting the court case which challenged Shantanand's inheritance of the title.[https://archive.is/20120905202522/http://www.paulmason.info/gurudev/TheLastInstruction.html] Paul Mason, The Last Instruction, Retrieved 24 June 2011 In a review of the documentary film ''[[David Wants to Fly]]'', ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' magazine reported Swaroopananda's assertion that "as a member of the trader class" the Maharishi "has no right to give mantras or teach meditation".{{cite news|url=http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117942181.html?categoryid=31&cs=1 |last=Simon|first=Alyssa|title=David Wants to Fly|work=Variety|date=14 February 2010}} [Swami Swaroopanand, successor to Guru Dev, in a village near Tibet. The swami tells Sieveking that the Maharishi, from a trader caste, was merely Guru Dev's bookkeeper and. Besides, he notes, "Gurus don't sell their knowledge, they share it."] According to religious scholar Cynthia Humes, enlightened individuals of any caste may "teach brahmavidya"Humes 2005 p. 57. and author Patricia Drake writes that "when Guru Dev was about to die he charged Maharishi with teaching laymen ... to meditate".Drake, Patricia Hemingway(1975) David Mckay Company, The Transcendental Meditation Primer, page XVII Mason says Shantanand "publicly commended the practice of the Maharishi's meditation"Mason (1994) p. 57 Note: "On Tuesday, 30 May 1961, eight years to the day after his master's death, the Shankaracharya of Jyotir Math, Swami Shantanand Saraswati graced the teacher training course with his presence and was received with all due ceremony. Arriving at the site where the new Academy was being built, he addressed the Maharishi and the gathered meditators . . . . He commended the practice of the Maharishi's meditation, describing it as a 'master key to the knowledge of Vedanta' and added, 'There are other keys, but a master key is enough to open all the locks.' and sociologist J.R. Coplin says that Shantanand's successor, Swami Vishnudevanand, also "speaks highly of the Maharishi".{{cite news|last=Kalambakal|first=Jupiter|url=http://www.allheadlinenews.com/articles/7009948300|title=Transcendental Meditation Founder Maharishi Dies|agency=[[All Headline News]]|date=6 February 2008|accessdate=2010-09-03|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080317075710/http://www.allheadlinenews.com/articles/7009948300|archivedate=17 March 2008|df=dmy-all}}Coplin, J.R. (1990) p. 61-63 Note: "Maharishi, though a devoted and favored disciple, was not eligible to become Shankarachaharya due to his caste background (non-brahmin). Nonetheless, he shares with the last two Shankaracharyas of Jyotir Math (who succeeded Brahmanand Saraswati) a brotherly relationship, known as "guru-bhais". Even today, Swami Vishnudevanand (the current Shankaracharya of Jyotir Math) speaks very highly of Maharishi and sees his teaching as a reflection of their master's. Both he and Swami Shantanand (his immediate predecessor) are frequent guests of Maharishi's both in India and abroad, personally endorsing his mission.".... "When Maharishi began teaching during his South Indian tour in the mid-1950s, he arrived as an informal representative of the Shankaracharya of Jyotir Math, being a 'great disciple of Shri Swami Brahmananda Saraswati (former Shankaracharya)'". ===Popular culture=== The British satirical magazine ''[[Private Eye]]'' ridiculed him as "Veririchi Lotsamoney Yogi Bear". The Maharishi was also parodied by comedians [[Bill Dana (comedian)|Bill Dana]] and [[Joey Forman]] in the 1968 comedy album ''The Mashuganishi Yogi'',{{Cite web|title=Between Yogis and Gurus, It May be Time to Get Smart|date=20 June 2008|first=Mira|last=Kamdar|publisher=Asia Society|url=http://asiasociety.org/style-living/between-yogis-and-gurus-it-may-be-time-get-smart|accessdate=27 August 2010|archivedate=28 August 2010|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5sJU3HncK?url=http://asiasociety.org/style-living/between-yogis-and-gurus-it-may-be-time-get-smart|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} by comedian [[Mike Myers (actor)|Mike Myers]] in the film [[The Love Guru]],{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/reviews/article-1040312/The-Love-Guru-Not-groovy-baby.html|last=Tookey|first=Christopher|title=The Love Guru: Not so groovy, baby!|work=Daily Mail|location=London (UK)|date=31 July 2008}} and in the BBC sketch show ''[[Goodness Gracious Me (BBC)|Goodness Gracious Me]]''.Dunphy, Grahme & Emiq, Rainer, Rodopi (2009) [https://books.google.com/books?id=EfU0YNqcR8IC&pg=PA184&dq=goodness+gracious+me+maharishi&hl=en&sa=X&ei=so8ET4nRCJDmggfi64iOAg&ved=0CDAQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=goodness%20gracious%20me%20maharishi&f=false Hybrid Humor: Comedy in Transnational Perspectives] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160702054649/https://books.google.com/books?id=EfU0YNqcR8IC&pg=PA184&dq=goodness%20gracious%20me%20maharishi&hl=en&sa=X&ei=so8ET4nRCJDmggfi64iOAg&ved=0CDAQ6AEwAA |date=2 July 2016 }} page 184 {{ISBN|9042028238}} {{ISBN|978-9042028234}} He was portrayed by actor [[Gerry Bednob]] in the 2007 film ''[[Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story]]''. He was also the subject of [[The Beatles]]' song [[Sexy Sadie]].{{Cite book|title=''Lennon Remembers''|page=27|publisher=Verso, W.W. Norton & Co.|last=Wenner|first=Jann|authorlink=Jann_Wenner|year=2000|origyear=1971|isbn=1-85984-376-X|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ymjy06WZnd4C&pg=RA1-PA27&dq=%22lennon+remembers%22+maharishi&sig=Z-ZRmuOd3HN0av5kTK6IuemPGTY}} In an episode of the popular [[BBC Radio 4]] fictional comedy show [[Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge (radio series)|Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge]] a comment is made about Yogi when Partridge is interviewing a spiritual man comparing him to [[Buddha]], [[Dalai Lama]], [[Uri Geller]] and "that man The Beatles went to see..." ==Other initiatives, projects and programmes== {{Main|Transcendental Meditation movement}} Maharishi International University (renamed [[Maharishi University of Management]] (MUM) in 1995), the first university the Maharishi founded, began classes in [[Santa Barbara, California]], in 1973. In 1974 the university moved to [[Fairfield, Iowa]], where it remains today. The university houses a library of the Maharishi's taped lectures and writings, including the thirty-three-lesson [[Transcendental Meditation#Science of Creative Intelligence|Science of Creative Intelligence]] course, originally a series of lectures given by the Maharishi in [[Fiuggi]], Italy, in 1972. Described in the MUM university catalogue as combining modern science and Vedic science,[http://www.mum.edu/Customized/Uploads/ByDate/2012/October_2012/October_5th_2012/2012-201338310.pdf MUM Catalog of courses 2012-2013 (Page 23)] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130606141547/http://www.mum.edu/Customized/Uploads/ByDate/2012/October_2012/October_5th_2012/2012-201338310.pdf |date=6 June 2013 }} the course also defines certain higher states of consciousness, and gives guidance on how to attain these states.{{Cite thesis|last=King|first=Jeams Lynwood|year=2007|title=Fundamentals of Maharishi Vedic Science|pages=14–15|publisher=Maharishi University of Management|url=http://www.mum.edu/dissertations/kingj.html|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100527235123/https://www.mum.edu/dissertations/kingj.html|archivedate=27 May 2010|df=dmy-all}}{{Request quotation|date=August 2010}} Though the university claims to grant PhDs, including in neuroscience and psychology, the university is not accredited by either the America Psychological Association (APA)http://www.apa.org/ed/accreditation/programs/index.aspx or the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education.https://apps.acgme.org/ads/public/ [[File:Maharishi Centre for Educational Excellence, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, India..jpg|thumb|right|200px|MCEE School Campus at Bhopal, India]] The [[Maharishi Vidya Mandir Schools]] (MVMS), an educational system established in sixteen Indian states and affiliated with the New Delhi Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE), was founded in 1995 by the Maharishi.{{Cite web|url=http://www.maharishiinstituteofmanagement.com/introduction.jsp|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5sMUXfvkO?url=http://www.maharishiinstituteofmanagement.com/introduction.jsp|archivedate=30 August 2010|title=Maharishi Institute of Management: Introduction|publisher=maharishiinstituteofmanagement.com|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} It has 148 branches in 118 cities with 90,000 to 100,000 students and 5,500 teaching and support staff.{{Cite web|url=http://ekikrat.in/Maharishi-Vidya-Mandir|title=Maharishi Vidya Mandir|publisher=Ekikrat.in|accessdate=30 August 2010|archivedate=30 August 2010|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5sMUviXLq?url=http://ekikrat.in/Maharishi-Vidya-Mandir|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} In 1998, Maharishi Open University was founded by the Maharishi. It was accessible via a network of eight satellites broadcasting to every country in the world, and via the Internet.{{cite news|title=Man Fails to Fly, Sues Camelot Owner|first=Nancy K.|last=Owens|work=Greater Tulsa Reporter|url=http://www.gtrnews.com/greater-tulsa-reporter/753/once-grand-camelot-hotel-had-a-quick-demise|date=26 October 2005}}{{cite book|last=Williams|first=Patrick Gresham |title=The Spiritual Recovery Manual: Vedic Knowledge and Yogic Techniques to Accelerate Recovery|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=w4t0GfHFPbQC&pg=PA261&dq=maharishi+Open+University&hl=en&sa=X&ei=lv3ZUvO0FfOssQS8mICoDg&ved=0CEoQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=maharishi%20Open%20University&f=false|year=2002|publisher=Incandescent Press|isbn= 9780970907813|pages=136, 228, 230}} The Maharishi also introduced theories of management, defence, and government programmes designed to alleviate poverty, and introduced a new economic development currency called the [[Global Country of World Peace#Currency|Raam]].{{cite news|url=http://members.forbes.com/global/2002/0708/025a.html|work=Forbes|title=Queer as a three-raam bill|first= Christopher|last=Helman|date=8 July 2002}} In 2000, the Maharishi began building administrative and teaching centres called "Peace Palaces" around the world, and by 2008 at least eight had been constructed in the US alone. The Maharishi Institute, an African university that is part of a group of schools around the world that are named after him, was founded in 2007 and uses his Transcendental Meditation technique in their teaching.[http://maharishiinstitute.org/the-institute/about-the-institute/ About] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161021222214/http://maharishiinstitute.org/the-institute/about-the-institute/ |date=21 October 2016 }} Maharishi Institute, retrieved 21 April 2012Anderson, Alistair (26 March 2012) [https://archive.is/20120723105102/http://www.businessday.co.za/articles/Content.aspx?id=168179 CIDA Institute may become, self funded university], Business Day retrieved 21 April 2012 Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, in his farewell message on 11 January 2008, announced the establishment of the Brahmananda Saraswati Trust (BST), named in honour of his teacher, to support large groups totalling more than 30,000 peace-creating Vedic Pandits in perpetuity across India.{{Cite web|url=http://hinduism.about.com/od/gurussaints/a/maharishi_obit.htm|title=Maharishi Mahesh Yogi Passes Away|first=Subhamoy |last=Das|publisher=About.com|accessdate=30 August 2010}} The Patron of the Brahmanand Saraswati Trust is the Shankaracharya of Jyotir Math. ===Organizations and businesses=== The Maharishi is credited with heading charitable organisations, for-profit businesses, and real estate investments whose total value has been estimated at various times, to range from {{USD}}2 to {{USD}}5 billion. The real estate alone was valued in 2003 at between $3.6 and $5 billion.{{cite news|title=The Maharishi's Hotel of Emptiness:Will the Beatles' former guru leave Hartford with a permanent blemish, or is there hope for the Clarion Hotel?|first=Chris|last=Harris|work=Hartford Advocate|date=13 November 2003}} Holdings in the United States, estimated at $250 million in 2008, include dozens of hotels, commercial buildings and undeveloped land.{{cite news| title=Sites for 'Maharishi Effect' (Welcome to Parma) Spread Across U.S.|first=Sean D.|last=Hamill|date=22 February 2008|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/22/us/22peace.html?_r=2|work=The New York Times}} The Maharishi "amassed a personal fortune that his spokesman told one reporter may exceed $1 billion".{{cite news|title=The 'Beatles' Yogi Became a Billionaire|work=[[Day to Day]]|date=4 March 2008|url=http://www.npr.mobi/templates/transcript/transcript.php?storyId=87890203}} According to a 2008 article in ''The Times'', the Maharishi "was reported to have an income of six million pounds". The Maharishi's movement is said to be funded through donations, course fees for Transcendental Meditation and various real estate transactions.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/07/02/business/worldbusiness/02maharishi.html?_r%3D1%26ref%3Dmaharishimaheshyogi |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-02-06 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151017004829/http://www.nytimes.com/2007/07/02/business/worldbusiness/02maharishi.html?_r=1&ref=maharishimaheshyogi |archivedate=17 October 2015 |df=dmy }} NY Times, Maharishi's Minions Come to Wall Street, Maria Aspan, 2 July 2007 In his biography of Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, The Story of the Maharishi (published 1976), William Jefferson suggests that the financial aspect of the TM organisation was one of the greatest controversies it faced. Questions were raised about the Maharishi's mission, comments from leaders of the movement at that time, and fees and charges the TM organisation levied on followers. Jefferson says that the concerns with money came from journalists more than those who have learned to meditate.{{Cite book|last=Jefferson|first= William|title=The Story of the Maharishi|publisher=Pocket Books (Simon and Schuster)|location=New York|year=1976|oclc=2737863}} ==Published works== *''Beacon Light of the Himalayas'', Azad Printers, 1955 *''Meditation : easy system propounded by Maharishi Mahesh Yogi.'', International Meditation Centre, 1962 *''Science of Being and Art of Living – Transcendental Meditation'', [[Allied Publishers]], 1963 {{ISBN|0-452-28266-7}} *''Love and God'', [[Spiritual Regeneration Movement]], 1965 *''Yoga asanas'', Spiritual Regeneration Movement, 1965 *''Maharishi Mahesh Yogi on the Bhagavad-Gita – A New Translation and Commentary, Chapters 1–6'', [[Arkana Publishing|Arkana]] 1990 {{ISBN|0-14-019247-6}} *''Meditations of Maharishi Mahesh Yogi'', Bantam books, 1968 *''Alliance for knowledge'', [[Maharishi International University]], 1974 *''Creating an ideal society: a global undertaking'', International Association for the Advancement of the Science of Creative Intelligence, 1976 *''Results of scientific research on the Transcendental Meditation program'', [[MERU]] Press, 1976 *''Enlightenment to every individual, invincibility to every nation'', Age of Enlightenment, 1978 {{ISBN|99911-608-9-2}} *''Freedom behind bars: enlightenment to every individual and invincibility to every nation'', International Association for the Advancement of the Science of Creative Intelligence, 1978 *''Dawn of the age of enlightenment'', MVU Press, 1986 {{ISBN|978-90-71750-02-1}} *''Life supported by natural law : discovery of the Unified Field of all the laws of nature and the Maharishi Technology of the Unified Field'', Age of Enlightenment Press, 1986 {{ISBN|978-0-89186-051-8}} *''Thirty years around the world: dawn of the Age of Enlightenment'', Maharishi Vedic University, 1986 {{ISBN|978-90-71750-01-4}} *''Maharishi's Programme to create world peace: global inauguration'', Age of Enlightenment Press, 1987 {{ISBN|978-0-89186-052-5}} *''Maharishi's master plan to create heaven on earth'', Maharishi Vedic University Press, 1991 {{ISBN|978-90-71750-11-3}} *''A Proven program for our criminal justice system: Maharishi's Transcendental Meditation and Corrections'', Maharishi International University, 1993 *''Vedic knowledge for everyone: Maharishi Vedic University, an introduction'', Maharishi Vedic University Press, 1994 {{ISBN|90-71750-17-5}} *''Maharishi's Absolute Theory of Government – Automation in Administration'', Maharishi Prakshan, 1995 {{ISBN|81-7523-002-9}} *''Maharishi University of Management – Wholeness on the Move'', Age of Enlightenment Publications, 1995 {{ISBN|81-7523-001-0}} *''Constitution of India Fulfilled through Maharishi's Transcendental Meditation'', Age of Enlightenment Publications, 1996 {{ISBN|81-7523-004-5}} *''Inaugurating Maharishi Vedic University'', Maharishi Vedic University Press, 1996 {{ISBN|978-81-7523-006-4}} *''Maharishi's Absolute Theory of Defence – Sovereignty in Invincibility'', Age of Enlightenment Publications, 1996 {{ISBN|81-7523-000-2}} *''Celebrating Perfection in Education – Dawn of Total Knowledge'', Maharishi Vedic University Press, 1997 {{ISBN|81-7523-013-4}} *''Maharishi Forum of Natural Law and National Law for Doctors – Perfect Health for Everyone'', Age of Enlightenment Publications, 1997 {{ISBN|81-7523-003-7}} *''Maharishi Speaks to Educators – Mastery Over Natural Law'', Age of Enlightenment Publications, 1997 {{ISBN|81-7523-008-8}} *''Maharishi Speaks to Students – Mastery Over Natural Law'', Age of Enlightenment Publications, 1997 {{ISBN|81-7523-012-6}} *''Celebrating Perfection in Administration'', Maharishi Vedic University, 1998 {{ISBN|81-7523-015-0}} *''Ideal India – The Lighthouse of Peace on Earth'', [[Maharishi University of Management]], 2001 {{ISBN|90-806005-1-2}} *''Maharishi Mahesh Yogi on Bhagavad-Gita – Chapter 7'', 2009, Maharishi Foundation International-Maharishi Vedic University, The Netherlands ;Discography *''The master speaks'', [[World Pacific Records]], 1967 ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Refbegin}} {{Refend}} ==External links== {{commons category|Maharishi Mahesh Yogi}} {{Sister project links|Maharishi Mahesh Yogi}} *[http://www.tm.org/maharishi Transcendental Meditation/Maharishi] *[http://www.maharishi-programmes.globalgoodnews.com/achievements/Maharishi-Achievements/02.html Official List of Lifetime Achievements] *[http://www.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0205/12/lklw.00.html Larry King interview with Maharishi May 12 2002] *[http://www.maharishi-programmes.globalgoodnews.com/publications/books.html List of books by Maharishi Mahesh Yogi] *{{DMOZ|Society/Religion_and_Spirituality/Hinduism/Gurus_and_Saints/Maharshi_Mahesh_Yogi/}} *{{Internet Archive author |sname=Maharishi Mahesh Yogi}} {{Transcendental Meditation}} {{Hindu reform movements}} {{philosophy of religion}} {{Religious pluralism}} {{Portalbar|Yoga|Biography|Philosophy|Hinduism|Spirituality|Indian religions}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mahesh Yogi, Maharishi}} [[Category:1918 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]] [[Category:20th-century Hindu religious leaders]] [[Category:21st-century Hindu religious leaders]] revision.comment: 1976, not 1979, is the correct year of her death. If you actually bothered to read the source you would know that.

revision.text:
{{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Ministry of National Education |nativename = <small>Ministerstwo Edukacji Narodowej</small> |logo = Logo men RP.gif |logo_width = 175px |logo_caption = Ministerial logotype |seal = Polish Governmental and Diplomatic Plaque.svg |seal_width = 150px |seal_caption = Official governmental wall plaque |formed = |preceding1 = |preceding2 = |jurisdiction = |headquarters = Al. J. Ch. Szucha 25, [[Warsaw]] |employees = |budget = |chief1_name = [[Anna Zalewska]] |chief1_position = Minister of National Education |chief2_name = |chief2_position = First Deputy Minister |parent_agency = [[Council of Ministers of the Republic of Poland|Council of Ministers]] |website = [http://www.men.gov.pl/ www.men.gov.pl] |footnotes = }} [[Image:Ministry of National Education Poland 2.jpg|thumb|250px|right|The seat of the Ministry of National Education]] [[Image:Dziedziniec gmachu Ministerstwa Wyznań Religijnych i Oświecenia Publicznego.JPG|thumb|250px|right|Inside the ministry's main courtyard]] The '''Ministry of National Education''' ({{lang-pl|Ministerstwo Edukacji Narodowej}}, MEN) is a ministerial department of the [[government of Poland]]. The ministry's prerogatives include setting educational standards and youth activities. Its functions do not include [[higher education]], which falls under [[Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Poland|Ministry of Science and Higher Education]].
The current Minister of National Education is [[Anna Zalewska]].
==List of ministers==
===Ministers of Education=== * [[Stanisław Skrzeszewski]] ([[Polish Workers' Party|PPR]]) 31 December 1944 - 28 June 1945 ([[Polish Committee of National Liberation|PKWN]]) * [[Czesław Wycech]] ([[United People's Party (Poland)|ZSL]]) 28 June 1945 - 5 February 1947 * [[Stanisław Skrzeszewski]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) luty 1947 - 7 July 1950 * [[Witold Jarosiński]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 7 July 1950 - 4 August 1956 * [[Feliks Baranowski]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 11 September 1956 - 13 November 1956 * [[Władysław Bieńkowski]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 13 November 1956- 27 October 1959 * [[Wacław Tułodziecki]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 27 October 1959 - 11 November 1966
===Ministers of Education and Higher Education=== * [[Henryk Jabłoński (polityk)|Henryk Jabłoński]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 11 November 1966 - 28 March 1972
===Ministers of Education and Behavior=== * [[Jerzy Kuberski]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 29 March 1972 - 8 February 1979 * [[Józef Tejchma]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 8 February 1979 - 2 April 1980 * [[Krzysztof Kruszewski]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 3 April 1980 - 12 February 1981 * [[Bolesław Faron]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 12 February 1981 - 6 November 1985 * [[Joanna Michałowska-Gumowska]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 12 November 1985 - 23 October 1987
===Ministers of National Education=== * [[Henryk Bednarski]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 23 October 1987 - 14 October 1988 * [[Jacek Fisiak]] ([[Polish United Workers' Party|PZPR]]) 14 October 1988 – 1 August 1989 * [[Henryk Samsonowicz]] ([[NSZZ Solidarność]]) 12 September 1989 – 14 December 1990 * [[Robert Głębocki]] ([[Liberal Democratic Congress|KLD]]) 12 January 1991 – 5 December 1991 * [[Andrzej Stelmachowski]] (no party) 23 December 1991 – 5 June 1992 * [[Zdobysław Flisowski]] (no party) 11 July 1992 – 26 October 1993 * [[Aleksander Łuczak]] ([[United People's Party (Poland)|PSL]]) 26 October 1993 – 1 March 1995 * [[Ryszard Czarny]] ([[Social Democracy of the Republic of Poland|SdRP)]]) 4 March 1995 – 26 January 1996 * [[Jerzy Wiatr]] ([[Social Democracy of the Republic of Poland|SdRP)]]) 15 February 1996 – 17 October 1997 * [[Mirosław Handke]] ([[Solidarity Electoral Action]]) 31 October 1997 – 20 July 2000 * [[Edmund Wittbrodt]] ([[Solidarity Electoral Action]]) 20 July 2000 – 19 October 2001
===Ministers of National Education and Sport=== * [[Krystyna Łybacka]] ([[Democratic Left Alliance|SLD]]) 19 October 2001 – 2 May 2004 * [[Mirosław Sawicki]] (no party) 2 May 2004 – 1 September 2005
===Ministers of National Education=== * [[Mirosław Sawicki]] (no party) 1 September 2005 – 31 October 2005
===Ministers of Education and Science=== * [[Michał Seweryński]] ([[Law and Justice|PiS]]) 31 October 2005 - 5 May 2006
===Ministers of National Education=== * [[Roman Giertych]] ([[League of Polish Families|LPR]]) 5 May 2006 - 13 August 2007 * [[Ryszard Legutko]] (no party) 13 August 2007 - 16 November 2007 * [[Katarzyna Hall]] (no party) 16 November 2007 – 18 November 2011 * [[Krystyna Szumilas]] ([[Civic Platform|PO]]) 18 November 2011 – 27 November 2013 * [[Joanna Kluzik-Rostkowska]] ([[Civic Platform|PO]]) 27 November 2013 - 16 November 2015 * [[Anna Zalewska]] 16 November 2015 – present
==See also== *[[Komisja Edukacji Narodowej]]
==External links== *{{pl icon}} http://www.men.gov.pl/
{{Ministries of the Republic of Poland}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Ministry Of National Education Of The Republic Of Poland}} [[Category:Education ministries|Poland, National Education]] [[Category:Government ministries of Poland|National Education]] [[Category:Ministries established in 2006|Poland, National Education]]

revision.comment: changed heading to match other awards
revision.text:
{{Infobox award | name = National Prize for Education Sciences | subheader = For contribution to the development of education at any of its levels, or to the sciences of education in Chile | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | description = | sponsor = [[Ministry of Education (Chile)|Ministry of Education]] | location = | country = [[Chile]] | presenter = | year = 1979 | website = {{URL|http://premiosnacionales.mineduc.cl/}} | holder = Abraham Magendzo Kolstrein }} The '''National Prize for Education Sciences''' was created in 1979 and is awarded every two years, in accordance with Law 19169 of 1992.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.leychile.cl/Navegar?idNorma=30536&idVersion=1992-09-26 |title=Ley 19169: Establece normas sobre otorgamiento de Premios Nacionales |trans-title=Law 19169: Establishes Rules on Granting National Prizes |publisher=[[Ministry of Education (Chile)|Ministry of Education]] |language=Spanish |date=26 September 1992 |access-date=8 December 2017 |via=Library of the National Congress of Chile}}</ref> It is part of the [[National Prize of Chile]] granted by the [[Ministry of Education (Chile)|Ministry of Education]].
The [[Juried (competition)|jury]] electing the winner is formed by the Minister of Education, the Rector of the [[University of Chile]], the last awardee, and two professors appointed by the [[Chilean Traditional Universities|Council of Rectors]] among the universities that deliver the Bachelor of Science in Education.<ref name="Decreto 315">{{Cite web |url=https://www.leychile.cl/Navegar?idNorma=12261 |title=Decreto 315: Aprueba reglamento del texto refundido, coordinado y sistematizado de las normas sobre premios nacionales de literatura, arte, periodismo, ciencia, historia y educación |trans-title=Decree 315: Approves the Regulation of the Refined, Coordinated, and Systematized Text of the Rules on National Awards for Literature, Art, Journalism, Science, History, and Education |publisher=[[Ministry of Education (Chile)|Ministry of Education]] |language=Spanish |date=26 December 1989 |access-date=11 December 2017 |via=Library of the National Congress of Chile}}</ref> The floating members of the jury are announced in the month of July of the year of the contest.
The prize consists of a diploma, a cash prize of about 17 million [[Chilean peso|pesos]] ({{US$|{{To USD|17000000|CHL|round=yes}}}}) and a lifetime pension of 20 {{ill|Monthly tax unit|es|Unidad tributaria mensual|lt=monthly tax units}} (approximately US$1,600).<ref name="Decreto 315"/><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.mineducacion.gov.co/cvn/1665/w3-article-294238.html |title=Presidente Piñera y Ministro Beyer entregaron los Premios Nacionales 2011 |trans-title=President Piñera and Minister Beyer Present the 2011 National Awards |publisher=[[Ministry of Education (Chile)|Ministry of Education]] |language=Spanish |date=11 January 2012 |access-date=11 December 2017 |via=Centro Virtual de Noticias de la Educación}}</ref>
==Winners== * 1979, Roberto Munizaga Aguirre<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.uchile.cl/portal/presentacion/historia/grandes-figuras/premios-nacionales/educacion/6656/roberto-munizaga-aguirre |title=Roberto Munizaga Aguirre |publisher=[[University of Chile]] |language=Spanish |access-date=11 December 2017}}</ref> * 1981, {{ill|Teresa Clerc|es}}<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://dsrd.uc.cl/descubre-la-uc/premios-nacionales |title=Premios Nacionales |publisher=[[Pontifical Catholic University of Chile]] |language=Spanish |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130124031214/http://dsrd.uc.cl/descubre-la-uc/premios-nacionales|archive-date=24 January 2013 |dead-url=yes |access-date=11 December 2017}}</ref> * 1983, Luis Gómez Catalán<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.uchile.cl/portal/presentacion/historia/grandes-figuras/premios-nacionales/educacion/6646/luis-gomez-catalan |title=Luis Gómez Catalán |publisher=[[University of Chile]] |language=Spanish |access-date=11 December 2017}}</ref> * 1985, José Valentín Herrera González<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.uchile.cl/portal/presentacion/historia/grandes-figuras/premios-nacionales/educacion/6643/jose-herrera-gonzalez |title=José Herrera González |publisher=[[University of Chile]] |language=Spanish |access-date=11 December 2017 }}</ref> * 1987, Marino Pizarro Pizarro<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.uchile.cl/portal/presentacion/historia/grandes-figuras/premios-nacionales/educacion/6624/marino-pizarro-pizarro |title=Marino Pizarro Pizarro |publisher=[[University of Chile]] |language=Spanish |access-date=11 December 2017}}</ref> * 1989, Eliodoro Cereceda Arancibia<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.uchile.cl/portal/presentacion/historia/grandes-figuras/premios-nacionales/educacion/6619/eleodoro-cereceda |title=Eleodoro Cereceda |publisher=[[University of Chile]] |language=Spanish {{redirect|Nature studies}} The '''nature study''' movement (alternatively, '''Nature Study''' or '''nature-study''') was a popular education movement in America in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Nature study attempted to reconcile scientific investigation with spiritual, personal experiences gained from interaction with the natural world. Led by [[progressive education|progressive]] educators and naturalists such as [[Anna Botsford Comstock]], [[Liberty Hyde Bailey]], [[Louis Agassiz]] and [[Wilbur S. Jackman]], nature study changed the way science was taught in schools by emphasizing learning from tangible objects, something that was embodied by the movement's mantra "study nature, not books". The movement popularized scientific study outside of the classroom as well, and has proven highly influential for figures involved in the modern environmental movement, such as [[Aldo Leopold]] and [[Rachel Carson]].Armitage, p. 13 ==Background== By the mid-19th century, a growing concern for the state of the environment began to take shape. In 1864, American diplomat [[George Perkins Marsh]] published the groundbreaking book ''[[Man and Nature]]''. Highlighting people's responsibility to the natural world, the work marked the beginning of the conservation movement.Krech, p. 441 Before the 1890s, the idea of nature study existed, but the "efforts had been sporadic and piecemeal".Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 327 Naturalist Louis Agassiz wanted to capture "learners in studying the natural world". His students, who were influenced by this philosophy, went on to provide the nature study knowledge in public schools.Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 325 It was Agassiz who coined the phrase, "Study nature, not books." ==Definitions== Nature study can be described as "conceiving of the movement as a loose coalition of communities composed of individuals, societies, and institutions able to find some common ground in the study and appreciation of the natural world".Tolley, p. 128 In "Leaflet I: What Is Nature-Study?" from a 1904 collection nature study lessons, [[Liberty Hyde Bailey]] presented the following description of nature study:
NATURE-STUDY, as a process, is seeing the things that one looks at, and the drawing of proper conclusions from what one sees. Its purpose is to educate the child in terms of his environment, to the end that his life may be fuller and richer. Nature-study is not the study of a science, as of botany, entomology, geology, and the like. That is, it takes the things at hand and endeavors to understand them, without reference primarily to the systematic order or relationships of objects. It is informal, as are the objects which one sees. It is entirely divorced from mere definitions, or from formal explanations in books. It is therefore supremely natural. It trains the eye and the mind to see and to comprehend the common things of life; and the result is not directly the acquiring of science but the establishing of a living sympathy with everything that is.
Anna Comstock defined the idea extensively in her book, ''Handbook of Nature Study'': "Nature Study is for the comprehension of the Individual life of the bird, insect or plant that is nearest at hand."Comstock, p. 5 Comstock continued that nature study aided "both discernment and in expression of things as they are".Comstock, p. 1 The movement came at a time when society was concerned with the future of the next generationKohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", pp. ?-? and with [[conservation movement|nature conservation]] itself,Tolley, pp. ?-? and because of this was met with high regard and high expectations. Though many efforts had come before 1890 by some naturalist and scientists to teach and expand the movement, the nature-study movement really did not gain momentum with the public until the late 19th century, early 20th century. The Nature Study changed the curriculum for children in many of areas of the country, and it also affected the way young and teenage girls were able to learn and find job placement. The movement was often related to creating a less extensive or formal science training for females. {{citation needed|reason=claim not substantiated by previous text|date=July 2015}} =="Study nature, not books"== Many scientists, teachers, and leaders throughout the United States agreed on the value of nature study, and the subject became an important part of how the natural world was examined in many areas of the country by the early 20th century.Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 324 Scientists gave public support to the philosophy and added to the creation of a curriculum and courses. The movement was particularly popular in the Northeast, the West, and the Midwest. The South also found some use for the idea of natural science in their agriculture schools, as well as at Tuskegee Institute in Alabama (now [[Tuskegee University]]) and Hampton Institute in Virginia (now [[Hampton University]]).Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", pp. 351–352 Nature Study could be found in both urbanized, highly populated cities and in rural school systems because of the involvement of scientists in designing and implementing curriculum.Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 326 For example, Wilbur Jackman created an outline of nature study with "life and its phenomena" which examined how the study of plants and animals would consist of zoology and botany (under biology), physics, chemistry, meteorology, astronomy, geography, geology, and mineralogy.Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 334 [[Lucretia Crocker]] along with women's clubs and other help in the Boston area, created a "[[Teachers' School of Science]]" in Back Bay at the New Museum of the Boston society. Along with a [[Ellen Swallow Richards]], Crocker created a mineralogy course for teachers. Teacher found such education in the Boston area because of area scientist that would teach their courses.Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 328 The American Nature Study Society was founded in 1908, and still exists today.Tolley, p. 129 The society was an important aspect as well in helping to bring about the Nature-Study movement. [[Anna Botsford Comstock]] is one of the society' past presidents. It is considered to be America's oldest organization for environment.[http://www.envirolink.org/resource.html?catid=5&itemid=84 The American Nature Study Society]. EnviroLink Network. Retrieved on June 9, 2010. [[Anna Botsford Comstock]] studied and worked as the head of the Department of Nature Study at Cornell University with her husband, [[John Henry Comstock]].Herrick and Smith, caption of p. 18 Cornell University was considered to be a major hub for the Nature Study movement. She wrote the ''Handbook of Nature Study'', which includes sections on how to teach the subject and how to teach the courses to children, and also includes sections from different species of animals and plants to even the skies. ==Education for children== Sciences were expanding in colleges and universities, and scientists felt "that students needed more and better preparation in secondary and primary schools".Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 329 Not only was the curriculum of schools evolving, but also was the system of education itself. Populations were rising in big urban areas like New York and Chicago, and there was legislation to require students to spend required numbers of hours and days per year in the school system. With a growing population due to immigration and other reasons, young people could be taught useful skills for life and academia in order to "share fundamental civic values and enlarged view of their world".Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 331 The nature study became the way younger students learned of their natural world.Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 351 This also came at a time when legislation was being passed for conservation in the country, which helped gather support from parents and educators in the country. Anna Botsford Comstock, stated in her book ''Handbook of Nature Study'', "nature-study cultivates the child's imagination, since there are so many wonderful and true stories that he may read with his own eyes, which affect his imagination as much as does fairy lore, at the same time nature study cultivates in him a perception and a regard for what is true, and the power to express it...Nature study gives the child practical and helpful knowledge. It makes him familiar with nature's ways and forces, so that he is not so helpless in the presence of natural misfortune and disasters." Comstock also felt that the nature study did not begin with books, but through the observations of life and form from the first naturalists.Comstock, p. 5–6 The point of the system being to "give pupils an outlook over all the forms of life and their relation one to another". Because of the importance placed on the new generation, the surrounding public watched the schools carefully with high expectations of the students in the late 19th century.Kohlstedt, "Nature, Not Books", p. 330 A study in Kim Tolley's the ''Science Education of American Girls'' showed that of 127 public school systems, 49% offered Nature-study in all grades, 25% offered in at least six grades, 11% in at least four grades, 5% in three grades or lower, and 10% did not offer it at all in 1925.Tolley, p. 135 ==Women in the movement== Women played many roles in this movement within American society. Some were able to find supervisory jobs, or jobs as professor in natural history at school districts, or institutions of higher learning. Some women helped to create the movement itself, like Anna Botsford Comstock, and also teachers were able to "[implement] nature study to varying degrees in their classrooms and occasionally modified the curriculum created by male professionals so that it favored the life sciences". Over the four years from 1915–16 to 1919–20 in the state of [[Wisconsin]], the percentage of women high school biology teachers increased from 50% to 67%. The number of women physics teachers increased from 3% in 1915–16 to 7% in 1919–20.Tolley, p. 121 The nature study movement gave a new outlook to the [[education of young women]] in the United States. In the later 20th century, opinions started to change about the movement, and it declined. Some male critics saw it as "romantic" or "sentimental". This created a gender issue that was forcibly imposed on the nature-study movement. By the beginning of the 20th century, many young women were attracted to the natural history movement.Tolley, p. 95 The Science Education of American Girls by Kim Tolley gives an explanation of high schools in America for females. "Higher schools for females served as important centers for the dissemination of the nineteenth-century ideology of separate spheres, institutions commonly located in small towns and in rural, rather than urban, areas. The ideology prevailed in antebellum southern institutions serving elite girls who never expected to work for wages outside the home, in northern schools that explicitly south to prepare teachers for the nation's growing common schools, and in Catholic academies on the western front."Tolley, p. 94 Others, such as [[Susanna Moodie]], and her daughter [[Agnes_Dunbar_Moodie_Fitzgibbon|Agnes Chamberlin]] who made nature studies to support her family, and Catharine Parr Traill investigated nature to describe the new territories where they found themselves in nineteenth century Canada.https://fishercollections.library.utoronto.ca/chamberlin_chrono ==See also== *[[History of education]] *[[Natural history]] *[[Outdoor education]] *[[Women in science]] *[[Nature deficit disorder]] ==Notes== {{reflist|2}} ==References== *Armitage, Kevin C. ''The Nature Study Movement''. University Press of Kansas, 2009. *Comstock, Anna Botsford. ''Handbook of Nature Study''. Ithaca: Comstock Publishing Associates, 1967. *Herrick, Glenn W. and Ruby Green Smith (Eds). ''The Comstocks of Cornell''. Ithaca: Comstock Publishing Associates, 1953. *Holtz, Frederick Leopold. ''Nature-study: A Manual for Teachers and Students''. New York: Charles Scribner's Sons, 1908. *Krech, Shepard, John Robert McNeill and Carolyn Merchant (Eds). ''Encyclopedia of World Environmental History: A-E''. New York: Routledge, 2004. *Kohlstedt, Sally Gregory. "Nature, Not Books: Scientists and the Origins of the Nature-Study Movement in the 1890s". ''Isis'', Vol. 96, No. 3 (September 2005), pp. 324–352 *Kohlstedt, Sally Gregory. ''Teaching Children Science: Hands-On Nature Study in North America, 1890–1930''. University of Chicago Press, 2010. *Tolley, Kim. ''The Science Education of American Girls''. New York: RoutledgerFalmer, 2003. * [https://fisher.library.utoronto.ca/resources/agnes-chamberlin The Agnes Chamberlin Digital Collection] ==External links== *{{Cite NIE|wstitle=Nature-study|year=1905 |short=x}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Nature Study}} [[Category:Education by subject]] [[Category:History of biology]]

revision.text:
'''Ninel Alexandrovna Kurgapkina''' ({{lang-ru|Нинель Александровна Кургапкина}}; 13 February 1929 in [[Leningrad]] – 8 May 2009, near [[St. Petersburg]]) was a [[Russia]]n dance teacher and former [[prima ballerina]] for the [[Kirov Ballet]] with over 50 years stage experience. She was named a [[People's Artist of the USSR]] in 1974.
Ninel Kurgapkina was one of the last pupils of [[Agrippina Vaganova]]. She graduated her ballet school and joined the [[Kirov Ballet]] in 1947, where she danced such roles as Aurora (''[[The Sleeping Beauty (ballet)|The Sleeping Beauty]]''), Myrtha (''[[Giselle]]''), Odette-Odile (''[[Swan Lake]]''), Kitri (''[[Don Quixote (ballet)|Don Quixote]]'') and Parasha (''[[Reinhold Glière|The Bronze Horseman]]'').
Despite their age difference, Ninel Kurgapkina was the first female ballet partner to [[Rudolf Nureyev]], and later also to [[Mikhail Baryshnikov]], both of whom were trained at the Kirov.
From 1969 she was a primary coach at the Kirov and also taught master classes at institutions including the [[New York City Ballet]], the [[Paris Opera Ballet]], and the [[La Scala|La Scala Opera Ballet]]. She was appointed a director of the [[Vaganova Academy]] in 1972. She was an Associate Ballet Mistress at the Masterpiece Dance Theatre since 1994.
==Death== She died, aged 80, in a road accident near [[St. Petersburg]], on 8 May 2009.
==See also== * [[List of Russian ballet dancers]]
==External links== * [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/culture-obituaries/dance-obituaries/5330894/Ninel-Kurgapkina.html Ninel Kurgapkina] - Daily Telegraph obituary *[http://www.ballerinagallery.com/kurgapkina.htm Biodata (Ballerinagallery.com)] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20070808000922/http://www.balletla.com/dancefaculty.html Biodata (Vaganova Ballet System Ltd.)]

revision.text:
'''P-20 longitudinal data systems''' are state-level educational databases in the United States designed "to capture, analyze, and use student data from preschool to high school, college, and the workforce."{{Cite web | title = Fact Sheet - Statewide Longitudinal Data Systems | work = [[United States Department of Education|U.S. Department of Education]] | accessdate = 2014-07-03 | date = July 2009 | url = http://www2.ed.gov/programs/slds/factsheet.html }} == Description == These databases are developed on different models in different states.{{Cite web | title = Developing and Supporting P–20 Education Data Systems: Different States, Different Models | work = Data Quality Campaign | accessdate = 2014-07-03 | date = February 2008 | url = http://www.immagic.com/eLibrary/ARCHIVES/GENERAL/DATAQ_US/D080201L.pdf | format = PDF }} Twelve elements are required in these systems:
* A unique identifier for every student that does not permit a student to be individually identified (except as permitted by federal and state law); * The school enrollment history, demographic characteristics, and program participation record of every student; * Information on when a student enrolls, transfers, drops out, or graduates from a school; * Students' scores on tests required by the Elementary and Secondary Education Act; * Information on students who are not tested, by grade and subject; * Students' scores on tests measuring whether they're ready for college; * A way to identify teachers and to match teachers to their students; * Information from students' transcripts, specifically courses taken and grades earned; * Data on students' success in college, including whether they enrolled in remedial courses; * Data on whether K-12 students are prepared to succeed in college; * A system of auditing data for quality, validity, and reliability; and * The ability to share data from preschool through postsecondary education data systems.
== Privacy and data mining concerns == Under the Obama Administration, over 1 billion dollars has been spent in developing databases designed for improving the educational system, including P-20 [[Longitudinal study|longitudinal data]] systems. Although these databases contain extensive [[personally identifiable information]], much of this information is "not kept in a format that allows officials to easily extract the complete file on any one child." {{Cite web |last = Simon |first = Stephanie |title = Big Brother: Meet the Parents |work = POLITICO.com Print View |accessdate = 2014-07-03 |date = 2014-06-05 |url = http://dyn.politico.com/printstory.cfm?uuid=2C52710D-E5C9-4655-B1C5-6CBEFAB99D6E |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140709155346/http://dyn.politico.com/printstory.cfm?uuid=2C52710D-E5C9-4655-B1C5-6CBEFAB99D6E |archivedate = 2014-07-09 |df = }} {{As of|2014|June}}, parents concerned about student privacy and [[data mining]] of student information have begun to organize opposition at the state level:
“We don’t know what they’re tracking and we don’t know what the implications are going to be for these children in the future ... Going for jobs in the future, trying to get into college — we’re in uncharted territory and we just don’t know the implication it’s going to have for the children. We need to slow down.”
== See also == *[[Longitudinal study]] *[[Liability and Student Records]] == References == {{Reflist}} {{USGovernment|sourceURL=[http://www2.ed.gov/programs/slds/factsheet.html Fact Sheet - Statewide Longitudinal Data Systems], ''[[United States Department of Education|U.S. Department of Education]]''}} == External links == *[http://nces.ed.gov/programs/slds/ Statewide Longitudinal Data Systems], National Center for Educational Statistics [[Category:Education in the United States]] [[Category:Education reform]] {{US-edu-stub}}

{{redirect|Pharmakon|other uses of the word Pharmakon|Pharmakon (disambiguation)}}
'''Pharmakon—Danish College of Pharmacy Practice''' ({{lang-da|Farmakonomskolen Pharmakon}}) is a [[university college]] situated in the [[city]] of [[Hillerød]] on the [[island]] of [[Zealand (Denmark)|Zealand]] in [[Denmark]].
The Danish College of Pharmacy Practice is a tertiary [[education]]al institution of [[pharmaceutical sciences]] that offers the [[higher education]] programme of [[pharmaconomy]].
Each year, approximately 220 [[high school graduate]]s with special [[skill]]s are allowed to begin the [[Research|studies]] of pharmaconomy as [[pharmaconomist]] [[student]]s at The Danish College of Pharmacy Practice.
With about 602 pharmaconomy students, Pharmakon—Danish College of Pharmacy Practice is the only college in Denmark (including [[Greenland]] and [[Faroe Islands]]) to offer the pharmaconomist education programme.
==International affairs== Pharmakon—Danish College of Pharmacy Practice plays an active role in the international arena. In 1996, it was designated as a [[WHO]] Collaborating Centre for Drug Policy and Pharmacy Practice.
Furthermore, the College hosted the secretariats of the Community Pharmacy Section of the [[International Pharmaceutical Federation]] and the [[EuroPharm Forum]].
==See also== * [[College of pharmacy]] * [[Pharmacist]] * [[Pharmaconomist]] * [[Pharmaconomy]] * [[Pharmacy]] * [[UCPH School of Pharmaceutical Sciences]]
==External links== *{{Official|https://www.pharmakon.dk/}} {{da icon}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = PrepMe LLC | logo = PrepMe Logo New.png | type = [[Test Preparation]], [[Adaptive Learning]] | slogan = | foundation = 2001 | location = [[Chicago, Illinois]], [[United States|USA]] | industry = [[Internet]], [[Education]] | revenue = | key_people = Karan Goel: CEO/Co-Founder
[[Avichal Garg]]: CTO/Co-Founder
Joe Jewell: VP/Co-Founder
Eva Prokop: VP Business Development | homepage = [http://www.prepme.com/ PrepMe.com] | num_employees = }} '''PrepMe''' is a for-profit [[United States|American]] company that offers online courses and tutoring for standardized achievement tests, in particular those offered by the [[Educational Testing Service]] (ETS), such as the [[PSAT/NMSQT|PSAT]] and [[SAT]]; and the [[ACT (examination)|ACT]] offered by ACT, Inc. PrepMe also developed its Coursification platform to open its adaptive online learning platform to publishers.Over 100,000 students have used the company's programs.{{cite news |first=Zak |last=Strambor |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Venture Prone |url=https://techcrunch.com/2011/07/18/blackboard-buyer-providence-equity-acquires-personalized-online-learning-platform-from-prepme/|work= |publisher=TechCrunch |date=2011-07-18 |accessdate=2011-07-18 |quote=More than Over 100,000 students have used courses built on PrepMe’s platform}} == History == The company was founded in 2001 by [[Avichal Garg]], Karan Goel, and Joe Jewell, [[Stanford]], [[University of Chicago]], and [[Caltech]] students respectively. It is based in [[Chicago]] with a software engineering team in [[Palo Alto, California]]. One of the company's co-founders, [[Avichal Garg]], a former Google product manager, raised investment capital from other former Google employees to fund PrepMe. The company was incubated at the University of Chicago [[Booth School of Business]]' Polsky Center for Entrepreneurship after it won the university's 2005 New Venture Challenge. On February 1, 2007, Maine governor [[John Baldacci]] announced that for three years PrepMe planned to let every junior in Maine use its online SAT preparation program without cost to themselves, their school, or the state. [http://www.maine.gov/tools/whatsnew/index.php?topic=Portal+News&id=29425&v=article-2006 Office of the Governor Release]. In 2008, PrepMe was recognized at the [[Chicago Innovation Awards]] and was featured on the front cover of [[Fortune Small Business]].{{cite news |first=John |last=Schonwald |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=College alumnus becomes first-place entrepreneur |url=http://chronicle.uchicago.edu/051103/entrepreneur.shtml |work= |publisher=University of Chicago Chronicle |date=2005-11-23 |accessdate=2009-03-17 |quote=The prize, which the magazine announced this month as its cover story, will give Goel’s new company PrepMe.com $35,000.}} On May 28, 2013, Hobsons launched the [http://www.sat-preparation.co.il/ PrepMe Vocabulary Quiz] Facebook Game to help students practice for the SAT.{{cite news|title=Hobsons Launches PrepMe Vocabulary Quiz Facebook Game to Help Students Practice for SAT|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2013/5/prweb10755898.htm|accessdate=28 May 2013|newspaper=PRWeb}} == Acquisition == In July 2011, PrepMe's adaptive learning platform was acquired by Ascend Learning backed by [[Providence Equity Partners|Providence Equity Capital]], which also owns [[Blackboard Inc.]] and [[Archipelago Learning]].{{cite news |first=Zak |last=Strambor |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Blackboard Buyer Providence Equity Acquires Personalized Online Learning Platform From PrepMe |url=https://techcrunch.com/2011/07/18/blackboard-buyer-providence-equity-acquires-personalized-online-learning-platform-from-prepme/|work= |publisher=TechCrunch |date=2011-07-18 |accessdate=2011-07-18 |quote=Digital learning company Ascend Learning is acquiring PrepMe’s adaptive learning platform and virtual classroom SaaS}} The acquisition gave Ascend ownership of PrepMe's Coursification™ platform, a software service launched in March 2011 that enables customized online-learning courses.{{cite news |first=Leena |last=Rao |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=PrepMe's Coursification Offers A Personalized Online Learning Platform |url=https://techcrunch.com/2011/03/28/prepmes-coursification-offers-a-personalized-online-learning-platform/|work= |publisher=TechCrunch |date=2011-03-28 |accessdate=2011-07-27 |quote=Online test prep company PrepMe is taking on the likes of online course platform Blackboard with the launch of Coursification, a web-based application for personalized online learning courses.}} PrepMe continues to provide college readiness and preparation services under license from Ascend.{{cite news |first=John |last=Pletz |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=PrepMe sells core technology to vocational ed company |url=http://www.chicagobusiness.com/article/20110726/NEWS08/110729906/prepme-sells-core-technology-to-vocational-ed-company |work= |publisher=Crain's Chicago Business |date=2011-07-26 |accessdate=2011-07-27 |quote=The Chicago-based startup will continue to offer its products that help students prepare for SAT, ACT or PSAT tests.}} In February 2012, PrepMe's PSAT, SAT and ACT test preparation business was acquired by [[Naviance]], a provider of college and career readiness solutions for high schools and other K-12 institutions.{{cite news|title=Naviance Acquires PrepMe to Enhance College and Career Readiness Solution|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/naviance-acquires-prepme-to-enhance-college-and-career-readiness-solution-139466298.html|accessdate=26 March 2012|newspaper=PRNewswire|date=16
